title: Data Scientist
full_description:
Chevron's Business Support Center (BASSC), located in Buenos Aires is accepting applications for the position of Data Scientist. Successful candidates will join the IT Organization which is part of a multifunction service center with a workforce of more than 1400 employees that deliver business services and solutions to the corporation across the globe.

Join our Team

The Data Science & Analytics chapter is responsible for providing Data Science, machine learning engineering expertise, and solution delivery across Chevron. Data Science & Analytics practitioners collaborate to drive innovation and digital transformation to support the future of energy.

Data Science touches all parts of the Chevron value chain (Upstream, Midstream, and Downstream) as we try to enhance business decision making process through effective use of data science modeling techniques.

The Role
The function of this role is to partner with the business to identify opportunities to apply data science approaches and create data science products that deliver business value.
The successful candidate that fills this position will have the skills to identify, prototype, and build data science products.

As a Data Scientist, you will:
Identify and frame opportunities to apply advanced analytics, modeling, and related technologies to data to help Chevron businesses gain insight and improve decision making, workflow, and automation.
Understand value of proposed opportunity.
Identify needed data and appropriate technology to solve identified business challenges.
Clean data and develop and test models.
Establish the life cycle management process for models.
Work with team lead to establish business stakeholder engagements to share team's accomplishments and to identify additional opportunities.
Provide technical mentoring in modeling and analytics technologies, the specifics of the modeling process, and general consulting skills.

Required Qualifications:
3 to 6 years of relevant experience.
Demonstrated depth in advanced analytics / data science methodologies (e.g., supervised and unsupervised learning, statistics, data science model development).
Proficiency and experience using programming languages including Python and SQL to perform data analysis and machine learning activities.
Proven ability to frame data science opportunities, leverage standard foundational tools and Azure services to perform EDA (for purposes of data cleaning and discovery), analyze and visualize data. Identify actions to reach needed results. Seek input to solve problems. Track progress & keep others informed.
Ability to quickly assess current state and apply technical concepts across cross-functional business workflows.
Experience with driving successful execution, deliverables, and accountabilities to meet quality and schedule goals.

Preferred Qualifications:
Working knowledge of Microsoft Azure and tools in its ecosystem.
Demonstrated working knowledge of Chevron's value chain (e.g., upstream, midstream, or downstream) and associated business workflows.

Relocation Options:
Relocation will not be considered.

Expatriate assignments will not be considered.

title: Senior Engineering Data Scientist - Wind Turbines
full_description:
The company:

Univers Bazefield is the world-leading provider of the Bazefield Operation Management System, specializing in the renewable energy market. We develop, sell, and deliver Bazefield as a SaaS (Software as a Service) platform or as an on-premises solution. The renewable energy sector is rapidly expanding and highly competitive and encompasses wind, solar, storage (BESS), hydro, and hybrid energy systems. This market includes both established, large-scale energy companies and new entrants. Our customers use Bazefield to monitor, analyse, and optimize their energy assets.

Univers provides the world's most comprehensive decarbonization system.

We help companies and countries optimize energy systems and reduce carbon emissions with accurate, reliable, and actionable decarbonization data. Our EnOS (Energy and Environment Operating System) platform connects on-the-ground operational technology and in-the-cloud intelligence to deliver real-time energy data and data-driven carbon monitoring, reporting, and abatement.

With 220 million sensors and smart devices connected, 550GW of renewable energy under management, and a community of over 500 customers, we're helping the world's leading businesses get the world to net zero-and what comes after it.

The challenge is immense, but so are the rewards. Join our team and help move the planet towards sustainability. For more information, please visit https://univers.com

Role: Senior Engineering Data Scientist - Wind Turbine Health & Predictive Maintenance

Location: Nantes, Paris, Madrid or within travelling distance to a Univers office location.
Role Overview:

We are looking for a skilled professional with a solid technical background in wind turbine technology to join our fast-growing team focused on the digitalization of renewable energy and energy IoT at Bazefield Univers. This role is based in Nantes or Paris, with remote work options available.

As part of this team, you will collaborate closely with a global network of renewable energy experts and work cross-functionally with front-end and back-end software development teams. You will contribute to the creation of AI-driven software products, specializing in wind turbine analytics and component failure prediction. Additionally, you will engage with external stakeholders, supporting clients in solving complex analytics challenges and optimizing their renewable energy operations.

Responsibilities:
• Drive Product Development: Actively program and contribute to the product roadmap, implementing both physics-based and machine learning-based solutions. Develop new product ideas and enhancements to maintain innovation and competitiveness.
• Predictive Maintenance Models: Build predictive algorithms focused on assessing the health of critical wind turbine components, such as blades, gearboxes, bearings, and generators, with an emphasis on vibration signal processing.
• Product Management: Determine the most effective way to present analysis results to users, ensuring they drive actionable insights and maximize value. Interact with the software engineering team to implement your ideas
• Integration into Software Platforms: Work with software development teams to integrate diagnostic algorithms into real-time monitoring platforms. Ensure the system is scalable, user-friendly, and provides engineers with actionable information.
• Continuous Optimization: Enhance existing monitoring systems and develop new algorithms based on evolving wind turbine technology, changes in environmental conditions, and new data sources (e.g., drones, lidar).
• Collaborate Cross-Functionally: Work closely with internal teams-Go-to-Market, Presales, Solution Architects, and Software Development-as well as external stakeholders, including renewable asset owners, developers, and O&M companies, to drive project alignment and value.
• Serve as a Thought Leader: Represent the company as an industry expert by presenting at conferences and trade shows, publishing papers, and engaging in market-facing activities to drive product recognition and adoption.

Desired Skills and Experience:
• Master's, or PhD in Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or a related field. Specialization in wind energy is highly desirable.
• Strong understanding of vibration analysis techniques and engineering practices within the wind industry.
• Proficiency in Python following clean code practices, experiences in time series analysis, statistics and machine learning
• Strong background in wind turbine performance analysis and fault detection
• Experience in condition-based maintenance (CBM) and digital twin applications in wind energy preferred
• Experience working with finite element analysis (FEA) or computational fluid dynamics (CFD) in relation to turbine performance or component health preferred

Job title:

Project: Physics-Informed Machine Learning for Numerical Simulation

About SLB:

We are a global technology company, driving energy innovation for a balanced planet. Together, we create amazing technology that unlocks access to energy for the benefit of all.

Global in outlook, local in practice - and with a united, shared passion for discovering solutions, we hire talented, driven people and support them to succeed, personally and professionally.

Location:

Abingdon, Oxfordshire

Description & Scope

Numerical simulation remains the only reliable method to solve partial differential equations to predict future states of a complex physical system - be it weather, fluid flow, quantum dynamics or orbital mechanics. SLB's state-of-the-art reservoir simulator is used to model such a fluid flow in porous media for various applications, including Carbon Capture and Storage (CCS) and geothermal energy systems. The drawback of traditional numerical methods, however, is that they are computational very intensive and are not practical for many realistic workflows.

In this project, you will work on developing a physics-informed machine learning model to predict how a reservoir system behaves when CO2 is injected into it. Machine Learning models have provably been shown to run orders of magnitude faster than conventional simulators and, once trained, provide a promising alternative or enhancement to traditional solvers. The ultimate goal is to use the developed machine learning model to find optimal locations and volumes of CO2 to inject into a subsurface in order to maximize carbon storage and accelerate the global push towards Net-zero.

Deliverables

As part of the Numerical Simulation team, you will work on developing a physics-informed machine learning model to solve Partial Differential Equations on general grids and geometries. You will have access to high-fidelity 3D simulator data to develop and train novel Neural Operator and Graph Neural Network architectures. You will also be integrating this model into full workflows to show that ML solutions run orders of magnitude faster than traditional methods and will have the opportunity to publish in top-tier ML and Applied Mathematics conferences/journals (ICML, NeurIPs, ICLR etc.)

Required Skills & Qualifications

Studying for a Masters or PhD in Machine Learning, Applied Mathematics, Physics, Statistics, Computer Science or a related discipline
Theoretical and practical knowledge in machine learning and deep learning
Strong programming skills and experience with one of Scikit/PyTorch/Tensorflow etc.
Ability to quickly understand and implement models from research papers

Experience in one of the following would be advantageous

Neural Operators, DeepONets or Graph Neural Networks etc
Knowledge of mass conservation equations and material balance
Simulation basics (numerical methods for solving PDE systems)

At ExxonMobil, our vision is to lead in energy innovations that advance modern living and a net-zero future. As one of the world's largest publicly traded energy and chemical companies, we are powered by a unique and diverse workforce fueled by the pride in what we do and what we stand for.

About Houston

ExxonMobil's state-of-the-art campus north of Houston serves as home to its Upstream, Product Solutions and Low Carbon Solutions businesses and their associated service groups. The facility opened in 2014 and accommodates more than 10,000 employees and visitors.

By bringing many global functional groups together, the campus provides employees with the tools and capabilities needed today, and in the future, to achieve business objectives and accelerate the discovery of new resources, technologies and products. It was designed to foster improved collaboration, creativity and innovation and enhance the company's ability to attract, develop and retain the top talent in the industry.

The campus is located in Spring, Texas, on 385 wooded acres immediately to the west of Interstate Highway 45 (I-45), at the intersection of I-45 and the Hardy Toll Road, approximately 25 miles from the cultural vibrancy of downtown Houston.

The campus was constructed to the highest standards of energy efficiency and environmental stewardship. Its design incorporates extensive research into best practices in building and workplace design through extensive benchmarking of the world's top academic, research, and corporate facilities.

Learn more about what we do in Houston here

About ExxonMobil Biomedical Sciences, Inc. (EMBSI)

Our history and our team : The mission of EMBSI is one that stretches back over six decades. Our team of scientists in diverse fields like epidemiology, toxicology, occupational and community health, and environmental sciences serve as in-house experts to support ExxonMobil in meeting the world's energy needs while keeping people and the planet safe. We opened our first facility dedicated to environmental health research in 1980. Since then, we've seen our work make an impact both close to home and around the world, including the development of new methods for health and environmental safety assessments. In addition to helping shape corporate policy and product development at ExxonMobil, we take pride in sharing our research with the global scientific community. Learn more about EMBSI here .

What role you will play in our team

As a member of the ExxonMobil Biomedical Sciences Inc. (EMBSI) team, you will work alongside scientists and engineers around the globe to understand, research, and develop health, environmental and product safety solutions for ExxonMobil and the communities we serve.

Working collaboratively with health and environmental teams to evaluate worker, consumer, and community exposures and risks associated with ExxonMobil products and operations
Providing strategic guidance in all aspects of exposure science to inform business decisions
Actively collaborating with interdisciplinary teams to envision and advance the methodologies needed to evaluate the next generation of ExxonMobil products and processes
Leading technical initiatives within professional organizations and trade associations to advance contemporary risk assessment methodologies and identify novel applications.
Advancing the scientific dialogue through presentations at technical conferences and publications in the peer reviewed literature

Broad experience and a graduate degree in exposure sciences, industrial hygiene, occupational and environmental hygiene, engineering, or a related field; experienced candidates strongly encouraged to apply.
Strong working knowledge of exposure assessment and engineering control approaches, models, and statistics to assess risk to workers, communities, and consumers
Interest in expanding breadth and depth across all areas of human health risk assessment
Displaying an interest and capacity to continuously learn and grow as an expert and leader
Excellent project management and communication skills (written and oral), including an ability to interpret scientific information for both experts and non-experts
Must be a team player, with ability to embrace change, build business relationships, and collaborate with individuals with diverse backgrounds and scientific disciplines
Ability to work and maintain focus in a dynamic, multiple-priority environment effectively and efficiently with minimal supervision
Demonstrated ability to lead, influence and collaborate with other scientists to produce impactful work products and publications
Ability to accommodate periodic domestic and international travel

Preferred Qualifications/ Experience

Familiarity with human health risk assessment principles
Familiarity with cumulative, co-exposures, and/or multi-pathway risk assessment
Experience with epidemiology, prevention through design, quantitative risk assessment, and/or life cycle approaches
Familiarity with exposure models, data analytics, informatics, machine learning, artificial intelligence and statistical approaches for risk assessment
Capability and desire to learn
The successful candidate is not required to have experience across all areas, but must have the interest and take initiative to learn and develop

title: Pulsed Power Engineering - Component Scientist
full_description:
About Pacific Fusion

Pacific Fusion was founded in 2023 with the mission to power the world with abundant, affordable, clean energy.

We are rapidly designing and building a pulsed magnetic fusion system to achieve net facility gain (more fusion energy output than stored energy input). In parallel, we are developing the key components required to build affordable fusion systems.

Our plans are ambitious. We have raised over $900M so far from incredible investors, resourcing us to deliver on these plans. We are bringing together the best scientists, engineers, and operators from the fusion community, hard tech industry, and other sectors. We are united by a shared sense of urgency to provide clean power for the world, particularly managing climate change while meeting growing global energy demand. You can read more about us in this letter from our founders.

About the Role

Job Overview:

As a Component Scientist, you will research and invent novel pulsed power components. You must have a proven record of research and development, advanced materials, energy storage and density, novel component invention, reliability testing, and going from R&D to production.

There are two components we are focusing on:
High-reliability, rep-rateable capacitor development. 100 kV, 50+ kA, million shot lifetime, 1 Hz rep-rate.
High-reliability, rep-rateable gas switch development. 200 kV, 50+ kA, million shot lifetime, 1 Hz rep-rate.

Other components in our pulsed power system include: anodes, cathodes, power supply, inductors, resistors, triggers and diagnostics.

Responsibilities:
Own the discovery and invention of new materials to be used for our highest volume and most critical components in order to increase the performance and longevity
Enable the affordability and commercialization of fusion through the discovery and application of new materials to withstand longer lifetimes and extreme conditions
Set up a lab to test and qualify materials used in all aspects of the fusion system
Bring best practices of materials R&D, specifically for polymer engineering, to components that have been looked over thus far

Qualifications:
Experience owning the R&D process for new materials, particularly around polymer engineering and energy storage
Starting from scratch with material discovery, reverse-engineering, and even building a materials laboratory for R&D
Expertise across the entire project spectrum from R&D through to production in the invention of novel materials and components
Thrives in a dynamic environment where we are building out material science capabilities while kicking off critical projects simultaneously

Benefits:
Industry-competitive salary
Equity plan
6% employer 401k matching
Generous paid time off (including sick leave, vacation, paid family leave)
Medical, Dental, and Vision insurance
